channel.title: Asking a question
channel.description:
I am posting this here, as i could not find a spot for this and since it is about asking Question i thought i should post it here.
Please Tell me if i should move this to another spot, It is not a tutorial.. Kinda :p
Asking a question is not as simple as asking for some codes or how do i do this.. There are a few things you should ALWAYS do before u start asking questions.
1, Use the search Bar!
So many people ask questions that have been asked a hundred Times and it gets realy annoying. If you ask a question that has already been answered, you are most likely to get flamed or Maybe even Warned!
so Before you ask a question always, and i mean always use the search bar, i mean.. It is what its for :p
2, search around.. if you search for something but can find anything, you should try scrolling around in other threads that might have answers to your problem in a different Format. Example? if i need help adding Real veng emote. this is what i would do.
1, Search for "Real Veng Emote" if i cant find anything i would go to step 2.
2, i would look in other threads, maybe there could be a tutorial that is called "Adding emotes" and in it, it could have the veng emote. but if i still cant find anything, Step 3 should work.
3, Make a help thread. Easy, but complicated at the same time..
Asking a question is simple as typing words, but what words should you type? Well the first thing you should do is introduce your problem. Don’t just say [code]need veng mote plox[/code] your not going to go anywere :l
But instead say something like [code]Hello, and i am just looking for a Veng emote.[/code]
Simple ey?
But it might help even more if you put your reason. Example
[code]Hello, and i am just looking for a Veng emote for my server, i think it would be a nice thing to add to my client.[/code]
So now if you read this. you should no how to ask a question with out getting flamed, spammed, or Warned!
Thankz ~Bonza

item.title: Asking a question
item.dc:creator: @bonza bonza
item.description:
@bonza wrote:

and by this you mean?
